intro: Rinorea palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests. Rinorea palawanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
